0.title: Adult Dosing
0.mono:
• Vidarabine injection was discontinued in the U.S.
  • Epithelial keratitis, Recurrent: (ophthalmic ointment) one-half inch into conjunctival sac(s) of affected eye(s) every 3 hr (5 times daily); after re-epithelialization, treat for an additional 7 days at a reduced dose (such as twice daily)
  • Keratoconjunctivitis, acute: (ophthalmic ointment) one-half inch into conjunctival sac(s) of affected eye(s) every 3 hr (5 times daily); after re-epithelialization, treat for an additional 7 days at a reduced dose (such as twice daily)

1.title: Pediatric Dosing
1.mono:
• Vidarabine injection was discontinued in the U.S.
  • Epithelial keratitis, Recurrent: (ophthalmic ointment; 2 years of age and older) one-half inch into conjunctival sac(s) of affected eye(s) every 3 hr (5 times daily); after re-epithelialization, treat for an additional 7 days at a reduced dose (such as twice daily)
  • Keratoconjunctivitis, acute: (ophthalmic ointment; 2 years of age and older) one-half inch into conjunctival sac(s) of affected eye(s) every 3 hr (5 times daily); after re-epithelialization, treat for an additional 7 days at a reduced dose (such as twice daily)

3.title: Indications
3.mono:
FDA-Labeled Indications
  • Vidarabine injection was discontinued in the U.S.
  • Epithelial keratitis, Recurrent
  • Keratoconjunctivitis, acute

3.title: Breast Feeding
3.mono: Micromedex: Infant risk cannot be ruled out.

5.title: Adverse Effects
5.mono:
Common
  • Neurologic:Foreign body sensation
  • Ophthalmic:Burning sensation in eye, Eye irritation, Finding of lacrimation, Photophobia

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono: Ophthalmic: Vidarabine is phosphorylated intracellularly to arabinosyl adenosine monophosphate (ara-AMP) or the triphosphate (ara-ATP). These cause preferential inhibition of viral DNA polymerase, inhibition of virus-induced ribonucleotide reductase, or inhibition of other virus-specific enzymes involved in DNA synthesis that are more sensitive to inhibition than the corresponding host cell enzymes. This inhibition prevents lengthening of the DNA chain. Vidarabine may also be incorporated into both mammalian and viral DNA.

10.title: Monitoring
10.mono:
• fever, symptomatic improvement, increased level of consciousness
  • (ophthalmic) improvement in keratitis or keratoconjunctivitis
  • CBC

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono:
• Patient should wear sunglasses outside and avoid bright lights, as this medicine may cause photophobia.
  • This drug may cause burning, irritation, lacrimation, and foreign body sensation in the eye.
